sentence.idiomatic: He thought you weren't coming, and so he didn't wait for you.
I thought he didn't know. I had no idea he knew early on.
I thought he was kidding. I had no idea that what he was saying was the truth.
I really had no idea that he was so good at basketball.
I hadn't come back for many years, I had no idea that my hometown had become so beautiful.
I thought that place was really nearby. I had no idea it was so far away, I walked for more than an hour.
His job is really relaxing. Every day he sits there sipping tea and reading the newspaper.
Life in the village is far more leisurely than life in the city.
I've thought about a leisurely life where there's no need to work or hurry.
No wonder he's been so nice to me lately. As a matter of fact, he wanted me to help him out.
The mother is so beautiful, it's no wonder that the daughter is also very pretty.
He spends two hours per day studying Chinese. It's no wonder he speaks Chinese so well.
This little guy is really a good talker.
I hear he is a great liar.
You are really good at telling jokes.
These days, opening a pet shop would be a sure way to make money.
Everyone works together, everyone gets rich together.
Where are you working these days?
Hey, wake up. We've arrived at the Coliseum!
Huh? Where is it?
Right in front of us!
I thought it would be really far away. I had no idea it was downtown.
So, people say Rome is like an outdoor museum.
But there are new buildings right beside the old ones. It's really interesting.
Let's go get a cup of coffee first.
Ok.
Romans sure have a relaxing lifestyle, sitting here every day drinking coffee and chatting.
That's for sure. They really know how to live.
It's no wonder so many Chinese people have come here.
But the majority of them come to do business.
True! All roads lead to Rome. You could definitely get rich here!
